intro: Thoa indica, commonly known as the Indian thoa, is a flowering plant native to the Indian subcontinent. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its erect, branched stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has traditional uses in herbal medicine. Thoa indica thrives in well-drained soil and requires full sun to partial shade for optimal growth.
